page.title: 10RELIGION IN OSSINGTON (3)
page.content: Perhaps the most important monument in Ossington Church is a{palimpsest {brass}commemorating Reynald Peckham and his wife which lies on the south side of the Sanctuary on an altar tomb.{Palimpsest means that it is an {old brass which has been altered for a {new memorial.}The effigies here have been cut from a large{German or {Flemish brass}which was originally made for a lady about{1360,}nearly 200 years before. Over the altar is a{17th century {painting of Christ healing at the Pool {of Siloam.}It was damaged by fire in 1974 but has since been restored. There is a{War Memorial}on the south side and close to the altar is a plaque from the{R.A.F.}who were stationed here during{World War 2.
